sentences.english: The shop plans to slash fur prices after Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 該店計劃在春節之後削減皮貨的價格。

sentences.english: The robbers put the arm on a big load of furs.
sentences.chinese: 強盜們搶劫了一大批的皮貨。

sentences.english: Another thing, I’d like to have the insurance of the goods covered at 130% of the invoice amount.
sentences.chinese: 另外，我希望按這皮貨發票金額的130%來投保。

sentences.english: My maternal grandfather is a capitalist, who is a famous "furrier" in the Tianjin bazaar.
sentences.chinese: 外祖父是資本家，是天津勸業場有名的“皮貨商”。

sentences.english: They trade in furs and skins.
Payment Official SKINNER invoices are emailed at the end of the auction.
sentences.chinese: 付款正式皮貨商發貨票被髮電子郵件在拍賣的末端。

sentences.english: I'd better not open any shop.
sentences.chinese: 還是別想着開什麼皮貨店了。

sentences.english: This craftsman works in leather, IE makes leather goods, etc.
sentences.chinese: 這個手藝人是做皮貨的。

sentences.english: There is no future in trying to sell furs in a hot country.
sentences.chinese: 在氣候炎熱的國家裏銷售皮貨是不會有前途的。

sentences.english: Did they look at leather goods in the craft fair ?
sentences.chinese: 他們在手工藝品交易會上看皮貨了嗎？

sentences.english: There's no future in trying to sell furs in a hot country.
sentences.chinese: 在氣候炎熱的國家裏銷售皮貨是不會有前途的。

sentences.english: The charming girl's gentleman friend was said to be high up in the fur business.
sentences.chinese: 那可愛的姑娘的男朋友據說在皮貨商界很有地位。
